title: Dua al-Iftitah
description: A profound supplication attributed to the 12th Imam (may Allah hasten his reappearance), recommended to be recited every night of Ramadan. It encompasses praise of Allah, blessings on the Infallibles, and a plea for the Just State.

preamble.arabic:
(1) روي بسند معتبر عن صاحب الأمر- إمام الزمان أرواحنا فداه- أنّه كتب للشيعة: ادعوا بهذا الدعاء كلّ ليلة من شهر رمضان فإنّ الدعاء في هذا الشهر تسمعه الملائكة وتستغفر لصاحبه.

والدعاء كما ورد في زاد المعاد(2) هو:
preamble.english:
(1) It has been narrated through an authentic chain of transmission from the Master of the Command—the Imam of the Age, may our souls be sacrificed for him—that he wrote to his followers: "Recite this supplication every night of the month of Ramadan, for indeed, the angels hear the supplication in this month and seek forgiveness for the one who offers it."

The supplication, as it is recorded in *Zad al-Ma’ad* (2), is:

phrases.english: O Allah, I begin the glorification with Your praise.
And You are the One who directs towards what is right by Your grace.

phrases.arabic: وَايْقَنْتُ انَّكَ انْتَ ارْحَمُ الرَّاحِمينَ فى مَوْضِعِ الْعَفْوِ وَالرَّحْمَةِ،
phrases.english: And I am certain that You are the Most Merciful of those who show mercy in the occasion of pardon and mercy,
phrases.transliteration: Wa ayqantu annaka anta arḥamu r-rāḥimīna fī mawḍi‘i l-‘afwi wa-r-raḥmati,

phrases.arabic: وَاشَدُّ الْمُعاقِبينَ فى مَوْضِعِ النَّكالِ وَالنَّقِمَةِ،
phrases.english: And the most severe of punishers in the station of exemplary punishment and retribution.
phrases.transliteration: Wa ashaddu l-mu‘āqibīna fī mawḍi‘in-nakāli wan-naqimah.

phrases.arabic: وَاعْظَمُ الْمُتَجَبِّرينَ فى مَوْضِعِ الْكِبْريآءِ وَالْعَظَمَةِ،
phrases.english: and the Greatest of the All-Compelling in the realm of Majesty and Grandeur.
phrases.transliteration: wa-aʿẓamu l-mutajabbirīna fī mawḍiʿi l-kibriyāʾi wa-l-ʿaẓamah,

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ اذِنْتَ لى فى دُعآئِكَ وَمَسْئَلَتِكَ،
phrases.english: O Allah, You have permitted me to supplicate unto You and to ask of You.
phrases.transliteration: Allāhumma adhinta lī fī du‘ā’ika wa-mas’alatika,

phrases.arabic: فَاسْمَعْ يا سَميعُ مِدْحَتى وَاجِبْ يا رَحيمُ دَعْوَتى وَاقِلْ يا غَفُورُ عَثْرَتى فَكَمْ يآ الهى مِنْ كُرْبَةٍ قَدْ فَرَّجْتَها،
phrases.english: Hearken, O All-Hearing, to my praise; and respond, O Merciful, to my supplication; and overlook, O All-Forgiving, my stumble. For how many a distress, O my God, have You relieved,
phrases.transliteration: Fasma‘ yā Samī‘u midḥatī, wa-ajib yā Raḥīmu da‘watī, wa-aqil yā Ghafūru ‘athratī, fakam yā ilāhī min kurbatin qad farrajtahā.

phrases.english: And anxieties You have dispelled,
And many a stumble You have pardoned,
And a mercy which You have spread,
And a circle of affliction You have broken,

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لَمْ يَتَّخِذْ صاحِبَةً وَلا وَلَداً،
phrases.english: Praise be to Allah, Who has taken neither a companion nor a child.
phrases.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhilladhī lam yattakhidh ṣāḥibatan wa-lā waladan.

phrases.arabic: وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ شَريكٌ فى الْمُلْكِ،
phrases.english: And He has no partner in sovereignty,

phrases.arabic: وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ وَلِىٌّ مِنَ الذُّلِّ،
phrases.english: And He has no protector out of weakness,
phrases.transliteration: Wa lam yakun lahu waliyyun mina 'dh-dhulli.

phrases.english: And magnify Him with all magnificence.
All praise be to Allah with all His praises in their entirety.
For all His blessings, in their entirety,

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا مُضآدَّ لَهُ فى مُلْكِهِ،
phrases.english: All praise is due to Allah, Who has no adversary in His sovereignty,
phrases.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhilladhī lā muḍādda lahū fī mulkihī,

phrases.english: And there is no contender to Him in His command,

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا شَريكَ لَهُ فى خَلْقِهِ،
phrases.english: All praise is due to Allah, Who has no partner in His creation.
phrases.transliteration: Al-hamdu lillāhi-lladhī lā sharīka lahu fī khalqihi.

phrases.english: And there is none like unto Him in His greatness,
phrases.transliteration: Wa lā shabīha lahū fī ʿaẓamatihī.

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الْفاشى فِى الْخَلْقِ امْرُهُ وَحَمْدُهُ،
phrases.english: All praise is due to Allah, whose command and praise are manifest throughout the creation.
phrases.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhi al-fāshī fī al-khalqi amruhu wa-ḥamduhu,

phrases.english: Whose glory is manifest through His generosity,
Who outstretches His hand with generosity,
He whose treasures never diminish,

phrases.arabic: وَلا تَزيدُهُ كَثْرَةُ الْعَطآءِ الَّا جُوداً وَكَرَماً،
phrases.english: And the abundance of His giving increases Him not, save in generosity and grace.
phrases.transliteration: Wa lā tazīduhu kathratu l-ʿaṭāʾi illā jūdan wa karaman.

phrases.english: Indeed, He is the All-Mighty, the Supreme Bestower.

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ انّى اسْئَلُكَ قَليلًا مِنْ كَثيرٍ مَعَ حاجَةٍ بى الَيْهِ عَظيمَةٍ،
phrases.english: O Allah, I ask You for a little from much, despite my immense need for it.
phrases.transliteration: Allahumma inni as’aluka qalilan min kathirin ma’a hajatin bi ilayhi ‘azimatin.

phrases.english: And Your self-sufficiency from him is eternal,
And it is much in my estimation,
And it is easy and effortless for You,

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ انَّ عَفْوَكَ عَنْ ذَنْبى وَتَجاوُزَكَ عَنْ خَطيئَتى وَصَفْحَكَ عَنْ ظُلْمى وَسَتْرَكَ عَلى قَبيحِ عَمَلى وَحِلْمَكَ عَنْ كَثيرِ جُرْمى عِنْدَ ما كانَ مِنْ
phrases.english: O Allah, indeed Your pardon of my sin, Your overlooking of my error, Your forgiveness of my wrongdoing, Your concealment of my foul deeds, and Your forbearance toward my many offenses, despite all that proceeded from—
phrases.transliteration: Allahumma inna ‘afwaka ‘an dhanbi wa-tajawuzaka ‘an khati’ati wa-safhaka ‘an zulmi wa-satraka ‘ala qabihi ‘amali wa-hilmaka ‘an kathiri jurmi ‘inda ma kana min

phrases.arabic: خَطَأى وَعَمْدى اطْمَعَنى فى انْ اسْئَلَكَ ما لا اسْتَوْجِبُهُ مِنْكَ الَّذى رَزَقْتَنى مِنْ رَحْمَتِكَ،
phrases.english: My errors and my intentional sins have emboldened me to ask of You that which I do not deserve, by virtue of the mercy You have bestowed upon me.
phrases.transliteration: Khaṭa’ī wa ‘amdī aṭma‘anī fī an as’alaka mā lā astawjibuhu minka-lladhī razaqtanī min raḥmatika,

phrases.english: And You have shielded me by Your power,
And You have made known to me Your response,
Thus I have come to call upon You in security,

phrases.arabic: وَاسْئَلُكَ مُسْتَأْنِساً لا خآئِفاً وَلا وَجِلًا،
phrases.english: And I beseech You with intimacy, neither fearful nor apprehensive.
phrases.transliteration: Wa-as’aluka musta’nisan lā khā’ifan wa-lā wajilan.

phrases.arabic: مُدِلًّا عَلَيْكَ فيما قَصَدْتُ فيهِ الَيْكَ،
phrases.english: Feeling emboldened before You in that for which I have turned unto You,

phrases.arabic: فَانْ ابْطَا عَنّى عَتَبْتُ بِجَهْلى عَلَيْكَ،
phrases.english: And if it is delayed from me, I reproach You out of my ignorance.

phrases.arabic: وَلَعَلَّ الَّذى ابْطَا عَنّى هُوَ خَيْرٌ لى لِعِلْمِكَ بِعاقِبَةِ الْأُمُورِ،
phrases.english: And perhaps that which has been delayed from me is better for me, due to Your knowledge of the ultimate outcome of all affairs.
phrases.transliteration: Wa la‘allal-ladhī abṭa’a ‘annī huwa khayrun lī, li-‘ilmika bi-‘āqibatil-umūr.

phrases.arabic: فَلَمْ ارَ مَوْلًا كَريماً اصْبَرَ عَلى عَبْدٍ لَئيمٍ مِنْكَ عَلَىَّ يا رَبِّ،
phrases.english: For I have not seen a gracious Master more patient with an ignoble servant than You are with me, O Lord.
phrases.transliteration: Fa-lam ara mawlan kareeman asbara 'ala 'abdin la'eemin minka 'alayya ya rabbi.

phrases.english: Indeed You call me, yet I turn away from You,
You endear Yourself to me, yet I respond with disdain toward You,
And You endear Yourself to me, yet I do not accept it from You,
phrases.transliteration: Wa tatawaddadu ilayya falā aqbalu minka,

phrases.english: As though I were the one conferring a favor upon You,

phrases.arabic: فَلَمْ يَمْنَعْكَ ذلِكَ مِنَ الرَّحْمَةِ لى وَالْإِحْسانِ الَىَّ،
phrases.english: Yet that did not prevent You from bestowing mercy upon me and showing benevolence toward me,
phrases.transliteration: Falam yamna‘ka dhālika min ar-raḥmati lī wal-iḥsāni ilayya.

phrases.english: And bestowing grace upon me through Your bounty and Your generosity.
So have mercy upon Your ignorant servant.
And bestow Your bounty upon him through the grace of Your benevolence.
Indeed You are Bountiful and Generous.
Praise be to Allah, Master of the Kingdom,
The One Who causes the ships to sail,
Subjugator of the winds,
Cleaver of the dawn.
Judge of the Day of Recompense.
Lord of the worlds.

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى حِلْمِهِ بَعْدَ عِلْمِهِ،
phrases.english: Praise be to Allah for His forbearance despite His knowledge.
phrases.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhi ʿalā ḥilmihī baʿda ʿilmihī.

phrases.arabic: وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى عَفْوِهِ بَعْدَ قُدْرَتِهِ،
phrases.english: And praise be to Allah for His pardon despite His power.
phrases.transliteration: Wal-ḥamdu lillāhi ʿalā ʿafwihi baʿda qudratihi.

phrases.arabic: وَالْحَمْدُ للَّهِ عَلى طُولِ اناتِهِ فى غَضَبِهِ،
phrases.english: And all praise is due to Allah for His enduring forbearance in His wrath.
phrases.transliteration: Wal-ḥamdu lillāhi ʿalā ṭūli anātihī fī ghaḍabihī.

phrases.english: And He is All-Powerful over whatever He wills.
All praise is due to Allah, the Creator of all creation.
Expander of Sustenance.
The Cleaver of the Daybreak,
Possessor of Majesty and Honor.
and grace and bounty,

phrases.arabic: الَّذى بَعُدَ فَلا يُرى وَقَرُبَ فَشَهِدَ النَّجْوى تَبارَكَ وَتَعالى الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لَيْسَ لَهُ مُنازِعٌ يُعادِلُهُ،
phrases.english: Who is so far that He cannot be seen, yet so near that He witnesses every secret conversation; Blessed and Exalted is He. All praise is due to Allah, who has no contender to equal Him.
phrases.transliteration: Al-ladhī ba‘uda falā yurā wa-qaruba fa-shahida-n-najwā tabāraka wa-ta‘ālā, al-ḥamdu lillāhi-lladhī laysa lahu munāzi‘un yu‘ādiluh.

phrases.english: And there is no likeness to resemble Him.
Nor is there any supporter to aid Him.
He has subdued the mighty by His might,
And the great have humbled themselves before His majesty,
Thus He attained by His power whatever He willed,

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى يُجيبُنى حينَ اناديهِ،
phrases.english: All praise is due to Allah, Who answers me whenever I call upon Him.

phrases.arabic: وَيَسْتُرُ عَلَىَّ كُلَّ عَوْرَةٍ وَانَا اعْصيهِ،
phrases.english: And He conceals every fault of mine while I disobey Him.
phrases.transliteration: Wa yasturu ʿalayya kulla ʿawratin wa ana aʿṣīh.

phrases.english: And He magnifies His favor upon me, yet I do not requite Him,

phrases.arabic: فَكَمْ مِنْ مَوْهِبَةٍ هَنيئَةٍ قَدْ اعْطانى وَعَظيمَةٍ مَخُوفَةٍ قَدْ كَفانى وَبَهْجَةٍ مُونِقَةٍ قَدْ ارانى فَاثْنى عَلَيْهِ حامِداً،
phrases.english: How many a pleasant gift He has bestowed upon me, how many a grave terror He has spared me, and how many a delightful splendor He has shown me! Thus, I extol Him, offering Him praise.
phrases.transliteration: Fa-kam min mawhibatin hanī’atin qad a‘ṭānī, wa ‘aẓīmatin makhūfatin qad kafānī, wa bahjatin mūniqatin qad arānī, fa-uthnī ‘alayhi ḥāmidan.

phrases.english: And remember Him, extolling His glory.

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى لا يُهْتَكُ حِجابُهُ،
phrases.english: All praise is due to Allah, Whose veil cannot be breached,
And His door is never closed,
And His petitioner is not turned away.
And he who places his hope in Him is never disappointed.
All praise be to Allah, Who grants security to the fearful.
And He delivers the righteous.
And He elevates the oppressed,
And He abaseth the arrogant,
And He destroys kings,
And He shall bring others to succeed.
And praise be to Allah, the Breaker of the tyrants,
The Destroyer of the oppressors,
O Overtaker of those who flee.
The Exemplary Punishment of the oppressors.
Succor of those who seek succor.
The station for the needs of the seekers,
The Reliance of the believers,

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى مِنْ خَشْيَتِهِ تَرْعَدُ السَّمآءُ وَسُكَّانُها،
phrases.english: All praise is due to Allah, from whose awe the heaven and its inhabitants tremble.
phrases.transliteration: Al-ḥamdu lillāhilladhī min khashyatihī tar‘adu-s-samā’u wa-sukkānuhā.

phrases.english: And the earth and its inhabitants tremble,

phrases.arabic: وَتَمُوجُ الْبِحارُ وَمَنْ يَسْبَحُ فى غَمَراتِها،
phrases.english: And the oceans surge, along with those who swim within their engulfing depths,
phrases.transliteration: Wa-tamūju al-biḥāru wa-man yasbaḥu fī ghamarātihā,

phrases.english: All praise belongs to Allah, who has guided us to this.

phrases.arabic: وَما كُنَّا لِنَهْتَدِىَ لَوْلا انْ هَدانَا اللَّهُ،
phrases.english: And we would not have been guided were it not that Allah guided us.
phrases.transliteration: Wa mā kunnā li-nahtadiya lawlā an hadānā Allāh.

phrases.arabic: الْحَمْدُ للَّهِ الَّذى يَخْلُقُ وَلَمْ يُخْلَقْ،
phrases.english: All praise is due to Allah, Who creates and is not created.
He provides sustenance, yet He is not provided for,
And He feeds, while He is not fed,

phrases.arabic: وَيُميتُ الْأَحيآءَ وَيُحْيِى الْمَوْتى وَهُوَ حَىٌّ لا يَمُوتُ،
phrases.english: And He brings death to the living and gives life to the dead, and He is the Ever-Living Who never dies.
phrases.transliteration: Wa yumītu l-ahyā’a wa yuhyī l-mawtā wa huwa hayyun lā yamūt.

phrases.english: In His hand is all goodness,

phrases.arabic: وَهُوَ عَلى كُلِّ شَىْ ءٍ قَديرٌ،
phrases.english: And He has power over all things.

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ صَلِّ عَلى مُحَمَّدٍ عَبْدِكَ وَرَسُولِكَ،
phrases.english: O Allah, bless Muhammad, Your servant and Your Messenger.
phrases.transliteration: Allāhumma ṣalli ʿalā Muḥammadin ʿabdika wa-rasūlika.

phrases.english: and Your trustee and Your chosen one,
And Your Beloved and Your Chosen One from among Your creation,
phrases.transliteration: wa ḥabībika wa khiyaratika min khalqika,

phrases.english: And the guardian of Your secret,
And the conveyor of Your messages,
The most excellent, the finest, and the most beautiful,

phrases.arabic: وَاكْمَلَ وَازْكى وَانْمى وَاطْيَبَ وَاطْهَرَ وَاسْنى وَاكْثَرَ ما صَلَّيْتَ وَبارَكْتَ وَتَرَحَّمْتَ،
phrases.english: The most perfect, the purest, the most increasing, the most pleasant, the most immaculate, the loftiest, and the most abundant of what You have bestowed of blessings, benedictions, and mercy.
phrases.transliteration: Wa-akmala wa-azkā wa-anmā wa-aṭyaba wa-aṭhara wa-asnā wa-akthara mā ṣallayta wa-bārakta wa-taraḥḥamta.

phrases.arabic: وَتَحَنَّنْتَ وَسَلَّمْتَ عَلى احَدٍ مِن عِبادِكَ وَانْبِيآئِكَ وَرُسُلِكَ وَصَفْوَتِكَ،
phrases.english: And You have shown compassion and bestowed peace upon any of Your servants, Your Prophets, Your Messengers, and Your chosen ones.
phrases.transliteration: wa-taḥannanta wa-sallamta ‘alā aḥadin min ‘ibādika wa-anbiyā’ika wa-rusulika wa-ṣafwatika,

phrases.english: And the people of honor in Your sight among Your creation,
phrases.transliteration: wa ahli l-karāmati ʿalayka min khalqika,

phrases.english: O Allah, send Your blessings upon Ali, the Commander of the Faithful.
And the successor of the Messenger of the Lord of all the worlds,
Your servant, Your close friend, and the brother of Your Messenger,
And Your Proof over Your creation,
And Your Supreme Sign and the Great Announcement.
And send blessings upon the Veracious, the Pure,
Fatimah, the Leader of the women of all the worlds,

phrases.arabic: وَصَلِّ عَلى سِبْطَىِ الرَّحْمَةِ وَامامَىِ الْهُدى الْحَسَنِ وَالْحُسَيْنِ،
phrases.english: And bestow blessings upon the two grandsons of mercy and the two Imams of guidance, al-Hasan and al-Husayn.
phrases.transliteration: Wa salli ‘ala sibtayi-r-rahmati wa imamayi-l-huda al-Hasani wal-Husayn.

phrases.english: The two masters of the youth of the people of Paradise.
And bestow Your blessings upon the leaders of the Muslims.
Ali, son of al-Husayn,
And Muhammad, the son of Ali,
and Ja‘far, son of Muhammad,
And Musa, the son of Ja'far,

phrases.arabic: وَعَلِىِّ بْنِ مُوسى وَمُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَلِىٍّ،
phrases.english: and Ali, the son of Musa, and Muhammad, the son of Ali,
phrases.transliteration: wa ‘Aliyyi bni Mūsā wa Muḥammadi bni ‘Aliyyin,

phrases.english: And Ali, son of Muhammad,
and al-Hasan, the son of Ali,
And the Successor, the Guide, the Rightly-Guided,
Your Proofs over Your servants,
and Your trustees in Your lands,
Blessings, abundant and perpetual,

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ وَصَلِّ عَلى وَلِىِّ امْرِكَ الْقآئِمِ الْمُؤَمَّلِ،
phrases.english: O Allah, and send Your blessings upon the guardian of Your command, the Upholder, the Hoped-for.
phrases.transliteration: Allāhumma wa ṣalli ‘alā waliyyi amrika al-qā’imi al-mu’ammali,

phrases.english: And the Awaited Justice,
And encompass him with Your near-stationed angels,

phrases.arabic: وَايِّدْهُ بِرُوحِ الْقُدُسِ يا رَبَّ الْعالَمينَ،
phrases.english: And strengthen him with the Holy Spirit, O Lord of the worlds.
O Allah, make him the caller to Your Book.
And the upholder of Your religion,

phrases.arabic: اسْتَخْلِفْهُ فِى الْأَرْضِ كَمَا اسْتَخْلَفْتَ الَّذينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِ،
phrases.english: Establish him as a successor on the earth, just as You established those before him.

phrases.arabic: مَكِّنْ لَهُ دينَهُ الَّذِى ارْتَضَيْتَهُ لَهُ،
phrases.english: Establish firmly for him his religion which You have approved for him.
phrases.transliteration: Makkin lahu dīnahu alladhī rtaḍaytahu lahu,

phrases.english: Replace his fear with security,
He worships You, associating nothing with You.
O Allah, grant him might and grant might through him.
And grant him victory, and grant victory through him,
And grant him a mighty victory,
And grant him an easy victory.

phrases.arabic: وَاجْعَلْ لَهُ مِنْ لَدُنْكَ سُلْطاناً نَصيراً،
phrases.english: And grant him from Your presence a helping authority.

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ اظْهِرْ بِهِ دينَكَ وَسُنَّةَ نَبِيِّكَ،
phrases.english: O Allah, manifest through him Your religion and the tradition of Your Prophet.
phrases.transliteration: Allahumma aẓhir bihi dīnaka wa sunnata nabiyyika,

phrases.arabic: حَتّى لا يَسْتَخْفِىَ بِشَىْ ءٍ مِنَ الْحَقِّ مَخافَةَ احَدٍ مِنَ الْخَلْقِ،
phrases.english: So that he may not conceal any part of the truth out of fear of any among the creation.
phrases.transliteration: Hattā lā yastakhfiya bi-shay’in minal-ḥaqqi makhāfata aḥadin minal-khalqi.

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ انَّا نَرْغَبُ الَيْكَ فى دَوْلَةٍ كَريمَةٍ،
phrases.english: O Allah, we earnestly desire from You a noble state,
phrases.transliteration: Allāhumma innā narghabu ilayka fī dawlatin karīmatin,

phrases.english: Through which You grant honor to Islam and its people,
And through it, You abase hypocrisy and its adherents,
phrases.transliteration: Wa tudhillu bihā an-nifāqa wa ahlahu.

phrases.arabic: وَتَجْعَلُنا فيها مِنَ الدُّعاةِ الى طاعَتِكَ،
phrases.english: And place us therein among those who call towards Your obedience,
phrases.transliteration: wa-taj‘alunā fīhā mina ad-du‘āti ilā ṭā‘atika,

phrases.english: And the leaders unto Your path,
And through it, bestow upon us the honor of this world and the Hereafter.

phrases.arabic: اللَّهُمَّ ما عَرَّفْتَنا مِنَ الْحَقِّ فَحَمِّلْناهُ،
phrases.english: O Allah, enable us to bear that which You have made known to us of the truth.
And whatever we have fallen short of, enable us to reach it.
O Allah, through him, mend our disarray.
And through him, mend our division,
And through him, mend our breach.
And through him, increase our small number,
And through him, grant honor to our lowliness,
And through him, enrich our poverty.
And through him, discharge our debts,
And through him, remedy our poverty.
And through him, mend our poverty,
And through him, ease our hardship,
And through it, make our faces radiant,
And through him, liberate us from our captivity.
And through him, grant success to our quests.
And fulfill through him our promises,
And through him, grant our supplication,
And grant us, through him, our petitions.

phrases.arabic: وَبَلِّغْنا بِهِ مِنَ الدُّنْيا وَالْاخِرَةِ آمالَنا،
phrases.english: And through him, grant us the fulfillment of our aspirations in this world and the Hereafter.
phrases.transliteration: Wa ballighnā bihi mina d-dunyā wal-ākhirati āmālanā.

phrases.english: And grant us, through him, beyond our desire,
O Best of those beseeched and the most bountiful of givers,
phrases.transliteration: Ya Khayra al-Mas’ulīna wa Awsa‘a al-Mu‘ṭīn.

phrases.english: Heal our hearts thereby,
And by him, dispel the rage of our hearts.

phrases.arabic: وَاهْدِنا بِهِ لِمَا اخْتُلِفَ فيهِ مِنَ الْحَقِّ بِاذْنِكَ،
phrases.english: And guide us through him to the truth concerning that which is disputed, by Your permission.
phrases.transliteration: Wahdinā bihī limakhtulifa fīhi minal-ḥaqqi bi-idhnika.

phrases.arabic: انَّكَ تَهْدى مَنْ تَشآءُ الى صِراطٍ مُسْتَقيمٍ،
phrases.english: Verily, You guide whomsoever You will to a straight path.
phrases.transliteration: Innaka tahdī man tashā’u ilā ṣirāṭim mustaqīm.

phrases.english: And grant us victory through him over Your enemy and our enemy,
O God of Truth, Amen.

phrases.arabic: اللهُمَّ انَّا نَشْكُو الَيْكَ فَقْدَ نَبِيِّنا صَلَواتُكَ عَلَيْهِ وَآلِهِ،
phrases.english: O Allah, we complain to You of the loss of our Prophet, Your blessings be upon him and his family.
phrases.transliteration: Allahumma inna nashku ilayka faqda nabiyyina salawatuka ‘alayhi wa alihi.

phrases.english: and the occultation of our guardian,
and the multitude of our enemies,
and the fewness of our numbers,
and the severity of the trials against us,
And the conspiracy of the times against us,
So bless Muhammad and his progeny,

phrases.arabic: وَاعِنَّا عَلى ذلِكَ بِفَتْحٍ مِنْكَ تُعَجِّلُهُ،
phrases.english: And aid us in that with a victory from You that You hasten.
And the affliction You remove,
And a victory through which You grant him honor,
and a rightful authority which You manifest,
And a mercy from You wherewith You shall envelop us.
And a well-being from You with which You clothe us,
By Your mercy, O Most Merciful of those who show mercy.
